abstractContent.text: The goal of this paper is to provide a description of the syntax of exceptive constructions within a dependency framework.
These constructions are introduced in English by the markers except, but, except for, apart from, other than, etc.
Examining their syntactic properties across a variety of languages shows that they imply two main types of constructions: The paradigmatic-EC and the hypotactic-EC.

The first type shares many properties with coordination, and it can be integrated into the paradigmatic lists/piles phenomena in which two segments of the utterance pileup on the same syntactic position and whose most famous case is coordination.
